qas.question: What areas were the first places colonized by the Portuguese?
When did the Portuguese first set up trading posts in Guinea-Bissau?
When did the Portuguese explore the interior of Guinea-Bissau?
Who controlled the inland trade in Guinea-Bissau during this time?
What ports were the Portuguese restricted to?

context: Although <a0_0>the rivers and coast<a0_0/> of this area were among the first places colonized by the Portuguese, who set up trading posts in the <a1_0>16th century<a1_0/>, they did not explore the interior until the <a2_0>19th century<a2_0/>. The <a3_0>local African rulers<a3_0/> in Guinea, some of whom prospered greatly from the slave trade, controlled the inland trade and did not allow the Europeans into the interior. They kept them in the fortified coastal settlements where the trading took place. African communities that fought back against slave traders also distrusted European adventurers and would-be settlers. The Portuguese in Guinea were largely restricted to the port of <a4_0>Bissau and Cacheu<a4_0/>. A small number of European settlers established isolated farms along Bissau's inland rivers.
